'''Krokorok''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ワルビル''' ''Waruvile'') is a dual-type {{2t|Ground|Dark}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Sandile}} starting at [[level]] 29 and evolves into {{p|Krookodile}} starting at level 40.

==Biology==
Krokorok is a reptilian Pokémon with a mostly tan body, pink stomach, black back, and long tail. It is classified as a quadruped, though it is more often seen on two legs. It has six thick, black stripes on its body: one at shoulder level, one around its midsection, one around its hips, and three on its tail. Each stripe is topped with a triangular spike on its back. The stripes around its midsection cross two spikes, one on each side of its back. Its arms are short and thin, with a black band around them at the elbow. Each hand contains three short fingers, each with a white claw. Its legs are thick with a band around each ankle, and a stripe above the knee that does not wrap around. Its flat feet each have three white claws. Krokorok's head is ovoid with a long snout, and small eyes surrounded by a thick black membrane. Two of its front and rear teeth are visible overlapping its lower jaw. A black stripe sits on the bridge of the snout just behind its large nostrils.

Krokorok prefers to live in the desert, usually in small groups. The black membrane surrounding its eyes protects them from sandstorms and acts as a thermal detector. This allows Krokorok to see the temperature of different objects, which also gives it exceptional night vision.

==In the anime==
[[File:Clay Krokorok.png|thumb|left|250px|Krokorok in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===In the main series===
====Major appearances====
=====[[Ash's Krokorok]]=====
Krokorok debuted in ''[[BW020|Dancing With the Ducklett Trio!]]'', where he evolved from the Sunglasses {{p|Sandile}} that was following {{Ash}} and {{Ashfr}}. He evolved while battling [[Ash's Pikachu]]. Ash later caught him in ''[[BW065|Battling the Bully!]]''. Later, in ''[[BW092|Ash, Iris and Trip: Then There Were Three!]]'', he evolved into {{p|Krookodile}}.

=====Other=====
A Krokorok appeared in ''[[BW061|Battling the King of the Mines!]]'', under the ownership of [[Clay]]. It was used in Clay's [[Gym]] {{pkmn|battle}} against Ash; it battled against {{AP|Oshawott}}, but lost.

====Minor appearances====
A Krokorok appeared in ''[[BW081|Crisis at Ferroseed Research!]]''.

A Trainer's Krokorok appeared in ''[[SM001|Alola to New Adventure!]]''.

A Trainer's Krokorok appeared in ''[[SM013|Racing to a Big Event!]]'', where it participated in the Pancake Race.

==Trivia==
* No other Pokémon have the same [[List of Pokémon with unique type combinations|type combination]] as Krokorok and its {{p|Sandile|evolutionary}} {{p|Krookodile|relatives}}.
* Krokorok is the only Pokémon with a base stat total of 351.
* Almost all of Krokorok's stats are ten points higher than Sandile's stats; the only exception is Speed, which is just higher by 9 points.

===Origin===
Krokorok seems to be based on the ''{{wp|Baryonyx}}'', a fish-eating, slender-snouted dinosaur which heavily resembled a {{wp|crocodilia}}n. Like its {{p|Sandile|pre-evolution}}, it is also based on a {{wp|crocodile}}, more specifically a {{wp|slender-snouted crocodile}} and the {{wp|spectacled caiman}}. Its eyes, pose, and stripes make it appear to be a criminal, which is supported by its Dark type. It could also be a reference to {{wp|Sobek}}, a half-crocodile deity also associated with violence and even robbery.

====Name origin====
Krokorok is a combination of corruptions of ''{{wp|crocodile}}'' and ''rock''.

Waruvile may be a combination of 悪い ''warui'' (bad/evil/sinful), ''evil'', ''vile'', and ''crocodile''. It may also derive from ''{{wp|gavial}}''.
